original_solution_mapping.L1: There are thirty games in the season because 20 + 10 = <<20+10=30>>30
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs to get 90 hits on the year to average 3 hits a game because 30 x 3 = <<90=90>>90
original_solution_mapping.L3: He has 40 hits already because 20 x 2 = <<20*2=40>>40
original_solution_mapping.L4: He needs 50 hits in the final 10 games because 90 - 40 = <<90-40=50>>50
original_solution_mapping.L5: He needs to average 5 hits a game because 50 / 10 = <<50/10=5>>5

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5300.
    Returns: the average hits per game Javier needs in the remaining games.
    """
    # L1
    initial_games = 20 # first 20 games
    games_left = 10 # 10 games left
    total_games_in_season = initial_games + games_left

    # L2
    target_average_hits = 3 # 3 hits a game
    total_hits_needed = total_games_in_season * target_average_hits

    # L3
    average_hits_first_games = 2 # averaged 2 hits
    hits_already_achieved = initial_games * average_hits_first_games

    # L4
    hits_needed_in_remaining_games = total_hits_needed - hits_already_achieved

    # L5
    average_hits_needed_per_game = hits_needed_in_remaining_games / games_left

    # FA
    answer = average_hits_needed_per_game
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are thirty games in the season because {initial_games} + {games_left} = <<{initial_games}+{games_left}={total_games_in_season}>>{total_games_in_season}

He needs to get {total_hits_needed} hits on the year to average {target_average_hits} hits a game because {total_games_in_season} x {target_average_hits} = <<{total_hits_needed}={total_hits_needed}>>{total_hits_needed}
He has {hits_already_achieved} hits already because {initial_games} x {average_hits_first_games} = <<{initial_games}*{average_hits_first_games}={hits_already_achieved}>>{hits_already_achieved}

He needs {hits_needed_in_remaining_games} hits in the final 10 games because {total_hits_needed} - {hits_already_achieved} = <<{total_hits_needed}-{hits_already_achieved}={hits_needed_in_remaining_games}>>{hits_needed_in_remaining_games}

He needs to average {average_hits_needed_per_game} hits a game because {hits_needed_in_remaining_games} / {games_left} = <<{hits_needed_in_remaining_games}/{games_left}={average_hits_needed_per_game}>>{average_hits_needed_per_game}

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'hits_already_achieved' (value: 40) was reported instead of 'average_hits_needed_per_game' (value: 5.0).
